intro: Wercklea pseudoferox, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun and well-drained soil. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Wercklea pseudoferox is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
